bullets.text: U.S. CPI rose 0.3% in December, with shelter and food driving gains—suggesting core services inflation remains sticky.
Real average hourly earnings were unchanged in December, implying wage gains are not outpacing inflation and household purchasing power is flat.
Fed approved Fifth Third Bancorp’s application, signaling routine regulatory clearance for bank actions amid heightened scrutiny of financial stability.
Escalating Trump–Powell conflict and a looming Supreme Court milestone raise perceived risk to Fed independence, a key anchor for rates and inflation expectations.
Oil jumped over 2% after U.S. signals on Iran (canceled meetings, support for protesters), highlighting geopolitics’ outsized role in energy risk premia.
Iran protests face reported brutal crackdown; reports of Starlink-linked free access underscore how connectivity can sustain unrest and complicate regime control.
U.S. plans to name a Palestinian committee to run Gaza, signaling a governance transition attempt amid continued conflict and regional diplomatic strain.
South Korea’s special prosecutor seeking the death penalty for ex-president Yoon over a martial-law bid raises political instability risk in a key U.S. ally.
Japanese equities opened at record highs amid snap-election expectations, reflecting investor sensitivity to fiscal/monetary policy shifts and political timing.
JPMorgan beat estimates on stronger trading revenue, suggesting market volatility is supporting bank earnings even as consumer credit risks remain a watchpoint.
Boeing outsold Airbus for the first time since 2018, with ~600 deliveries—improving aerospace cycle momentum and supply-chain execution credibility.
Meta VR layoffs and studio closures underscore a capital and talent reallocation toward AI, reinforcing industry-wide reprioritization away from metaverse bets.
AI research advances: models detect dangerous blood cells doctors miss, pointing to near-term clinical decision support rather than patient-facing chatbots.
Climate and environment updates: Thwaites Glacier fieldwork underscores measurement challenges, while studies find substantial plastic in city air, elevating health/climate risks.
